data.title: Can't Open Folder as VS Code Project.
data.body:
After last update (1.15) i reinstall vs code with win X64
now i can't Open Folder as VS Code Project.

Steps : 
Right click on any folder 
Choose Open Folder as VS Code Project.
Application throw's an Error  "Application not found"

data.title: Compound launch configuration not preserved
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:09:15.006Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-32-generic

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create compound launch configuration based on two other configurations
2. Select compound configuration and start debugging
3. While starting, selected configuration will be changed to some other non compound 
4. Next time you must again manually select compound configuration 

This was working in 1.14.

data.title: Emmet
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0

Плагин emmet для некоторых тэгов html5 не показывает предложения (например, header, nav, footer, canvas).

Для тэгов, которые не входят в состав HTML5 тоже не работают. 
Список тэгов:
- table
- blockquote
- pre
- sup
- sub
- title
- plaintext
- noscript
- legend
- u
- code
- comment
- caption
- colgroup
- button
- big
- applet
- address
- strong
- small

data.title: Feature Request: Is it possible to get a search feature in Debug Console and Terminal?
data.body:
Hi Team,

I am a fan of VS Code and it the only IDE that I use for web and server development. however I always miss a feature which is a basic search in terminal window and debug console.

It is possible to expect such a feature in future?

Your Fan,
Vikas Bansal

data.title: [Microsoft Visual C++ Updates] 2015 and 2005 Redistributable
data.body: Hello :) My Windows 10 PC is currently requesting updates on Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables from 2015 and 2005. Where can I download both files for update and why do I need to download two different versions released within 10 years time? Thanks a lot. Best, Mariana.

Since we can use emmet to generate xml/html, it should be easy to generage json as well.

And I believe this could be one killer feature ...

Thanks!

data.title: Incorrect renderWhitespace for proportional fonts
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:16:18.034Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
python|don|0.7.0
cpptools|ms-|0.12.2



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set parameters:

    "editor.fontSize": 13,
    "editor.fontFamily": "Lucida Sans Unicode",
    "editor.renderWhitespace": "all"

2. Open new file and write 4 spaces. Rendered dots will be twice wider than real spaces.

Even more:

3. write down `foo` and 4 spaces, caret will be at most right position after rendered dots (incorrect according to proportional font)
4. start typing some letter - it will be inserted before caret, and caret will be moved to correct position


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Javascript syntax highlighting fails with ES6 arrow functions with arguments split over multiple lines, if arguments contain default array or string
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:06:21.685Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
Ionide-fsharp|Ion|2.32.0
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.8.0
project-manager|ale|0.19.0
vscode-database|baj|1.2.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
githistory|don|0.2.3
pgsql|dou|0.0.8
gitlens|eam|4.3.3
crystal-lang|fau|0.2.17
auto-close-tag|for|0.4.3
haml|kar|0.7.2
comment|kar|4.0.8
Go|luk|0.6.63
vscode-elixir|mjm|0.5.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7
Ruby|reb|0.13.0
RustyCode|sav|0.19.1
vscode-parinfer|sha|0.6.1
vim|vsc|0.9.0
vscode-todo-highlight|way|0.5.8
JavaScriptSnippets|xab|1.4.1

(2 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Just paste this code into a new buffer and configure it to be JavaScript:

    ``` javascript
    const fn = ({
      arg = [],
    }) => {
      return "This line should be highlighted correctly";
    }
    ```

2. Compare highlighting between:

    1. Code above _(incorrect highlighting)_:
        ![2017-08-11 at 8 30 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2560/29209859-106572cc-7ed4-11e7-9d7e-70139a9526ad.png)


    2. Arguments on single line _(correct highlighting)_:
        ![2017-08-11 at 8 32 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2560/29209907-46e9ec2e-7ed4-11e7-8023-f024073a1aab.png)

    3. No `[]` or `"string"` as default argument value _(correct highlighting)_:
        ![2017-08-11 at 8 33 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2560/29209918-593792aa-7ed4-11e7-8162-63a5c98f3cac.png)

This example is obviously simplified from where I encountered it. Highlighting resumed midway through my function after a ternary expression (the `:` specifically). I could replicate the behaviour with either a string or array default value (empty or non-empty did not matter).

Reproduces without extensions: *Yes*

1. Open some folder with Git repo
2. Add another folder with Git repo
3. Make change in second folder
4. Open VCS sidebar tab

Expected:
- Changed file appears

Actual:
- No changed files in list

Tried disable Git related extensions and still reproduce.
Screenshots: [Folders](https://cl.ly/lxpZ) & [VCS tab](https://cl.ly/ly0Z).
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

Can you help me find extension brokes this?

data.title: ARM is not included in Electron targets
data.body:
Currently the targets list does not include ARMv7, even though Electron releases builds for this architecture (and VS Code supports it).  This is fine if building on ARMv7 directly, but inhibits cross-compilation.

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/3e27c42d7a832f49e569b9d20d0aeb1911db6b37/build/gulpfile.vscode.js#L171-L173

Suggest adding an electron-arm target to this list.

data.title: Typescript: Paste screws up format

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This now feels a **lot** like what frustrated me 5 years ago in Visual Studio.

Not only paste now gets indentation wrong most of the time, it does it in two steps, requiring a double undo to go back.

This was even pointed out today in our HackerNews thread: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=14983231

data.title: Make quick open optionally open file in real tab instead of preview
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0
- OS Version: Win 10

Sometimes it would be nice to be able to open a file in a real tab while having preview enabled. So quick open would still open in preview on enter, but on e.g. shift+enter or ctrl+enter it would open in a real tab.

How it could work:

1. ctrl+p, type filename
2. shift+enter to open in real tab, not preview (just enter would still open in preview)

data.title: [json] hover over color box doesn't show color picker
data.body:
It seems I am not presented with the color picker when I hover over colors inside settings (e.g. `workbench.colorCustomizations`). 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/29206840-01968be6-7e84-11e7-83f3-f8ecf0801185.png)

data.title: Color picker: top right corner is not clear to me
data.body:
It seems the top-right corner shows the color I had in the beginning, if so, we should:
* allow to restore it when I click it
* maybe show a description or make it otherwise more clear that this was the original color

Otherwise it looks like a UX bug where we fail to update parts of the box with the selected color

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/29206804-d6015c54-7e83-11e7-8699-cd323f6c08ad.png)

data.title: Color Picker: Text hard to read when picking certain colors
Color Picker: Integrate inline color boxes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently, languages are forced to create decorations in order to have those inline color boxes.

With the new color API, the core should be doing this for them.
